Apple___Apple_scab.symptoms: Dark, scabby lesions on leaves and fruit. Leaves may yellow and drop early. Fruit develops dark, corky spots.
Apple___Apple_scab.treatment: Apply fungicides containing captan or myclobutanil. Remove fallen leaves. Prune for better air circulation. Plant resistant varieties.

Apple___Black_rot.symptoms: Brown to black circular spots on leaves with concentric rings. Fruit develops dark, sunken cankers.
Apple___Black_rot.treatment: Remove infected plant parts. Apply copper-based fungicides. Improve air circulation through pruning. Avoid overhead watering.

Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.symptoms: Bright orange spots on upper leaf surfaces. Yellow lesions with black dots on undersides.
Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.treatment: Remove nearby cedar trees if possible. Apply preventive fungicides in spring. Use resistant apple varieties.

Apple___healthy.symptoms: No disease symptoms present. Leaves are green and healthy.
Apple___healthy.treatment: Continue regular care: proper watering, fertilization, and monitoring for early disease detection.

Blueberry___healthy.symptoms: No disease symptoms present. Leaves are green and healthy.
Blueberry___healthy.treatment: Maintain proper soil pH (4.5-5.5). Ensure good drainage and regular watering during fruit development.

Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.symptoms: White, powdery coating on leaves, shoots, and fruit. Leaves may curl and become distorted.
Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.treatment: Apply sulfur-based fungicides. Improve air circulation. Remove infected plant parts. Avoid overhead watering.

Cherry_(including_sour)___healthy.symptoms: No disease symptoms present. Leaves are green and healthy.
Cherry_(including_sour)___healthy.treatment: Regular pruning for air circulation. Monitor for pests and diseases. Proper fertilization and watering.

Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray.symptoms: Rectangular gray to tan lesions with dark borders on leaves. Lesions run parallel to leaf veins.
Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray.treatment: Rotate crops. Use resistant varieties. Apply fungicides containing strobilurin or triazole. Remove crop debris.

Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_.symptoms: Small, circular to oval, reddish-brown pustules on both leaf surfaces.
Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_.treatment: Plant resistant varieties. Apply fungicides if severe. Ensure proper plant spacing for air circulation.

Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.symptoms: Large, elliptical, gray-green lesions on leaves. Lesions may have dark borders.
Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.treatment: Use resistant varieties. Rotate crops. Apply fungicides containing strobilurin. Remove infected debris.

Corn_(maize)___healthy.symptoms: No disease symptoms present. Leaves are green and healthy.
Corn_(maize)___healthy.treatment: Maintain proper fertilization. Ensure adequate spacing. Monitor for pests and diseases regularly.

Grape___Black_rot.symptoms: Circular brown spots on leaves. Fruit develops dark, mummified berries.
Grape___Black_rot.treatment: Remove mummified berries and infected leaves. Apply fungicides containing captan or mancozeb. Improve air circulation.

Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).symptoms: Interveinal chlorosis and necrosis on leaves. Dark streaking in wood. Fruit may show dark spots.
Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).treatment: Prune infected wood. Apply wound protectants. Use trunk injection treatments. Remove severely infected vines.

Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo.symptoms: Small, dark spots on leaves that may coalesce. Leaves may yellow and drop prematurely.
Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo.treatment: Apply copper-based fungicides. Remove infected leaves. Improve air circulation through pruning.

Grape___healthy.symptoms: No disease symptoms present. Leaves are green and healthy.
Grape___healthy.treatment: Regular pruning for air circulation. Monitor for diseases. Proper fertilization and irrigation management.

Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).symptoms: Yellow shoots, mottled leaves, small bitter fruit. Asymmetrical leaf yellowing.
Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).treatment: Remove infected trees immediately. Control psyllid vectors with insecticides. Plant disease-free nursery stock.

Peach___Bacterial_spot.symptoms: Small, dark spots on leaves and fruit. Leaves may have shot-hole appearance.
Peach___Bacterial_spot.treatment: Apply copper-based bactericides. Remove infected plant parts. Avoid overhead irrigation. Use resistant varieties.

Peach___healthy.symptoms: No disease symptoms present. Leaves are green and healthy.
Peach___healthy.treatment: Regular pruning for air circulation. Proper fertilization. Monitor for pests and diseases.

Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot.symptoms: Small, dark, raised spots on leaves and fruit. Leaves may yellow and drop.
Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot.treatment: Use copper-based bactericides. Remove infected plants. Rotate crops. Use certified disease-free seeds.

Pepper,_bell___healthy.symptoms: No disease symptoms present. Leaves are green and healthy.
Pepper,_bell___healthy.treatment: Maintain proper spacing. Ensure good drainage. Regular monitoring for pests and diseases.

Potato___Early_blight.symptoms: Dark, concentric ring spots on older leaves. Leaves yellow and die from bottom up.
Potato___Early_blight.treatment: Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil or mancozeb. Remove infected foliage. Rotate crops. Improve air circulation.

Potato___Late_blight.symptoms: Water-soaked lesions on leaves that turn brown. White fuzzy growth on leaf undersides in humid conditions.
Potato___Late_blight.treatment: Apply fungicides containing metalaxyl or copper. Remove infected plants immediately. Avoid overhead watering.

Potato___healthy.symptoms: No disease symptoms present. Leaves are green and healthy.
Potato___healthy.treatment: Proper crop rotation. Ensure good drainage. Monitor regularly for disease symptoms.

Raspberry___healthy.symptoms: No disease symptoms present. Leaves are green and healthy.
Raspberry___healthy.treatment: Regular pruning of old canes. Ensure good air circulation. Proper fertilization and watering.

Soybean___healthy.symptoms: No disease symptoms present. Leaves are green and healthy.
Soybean___healthy.treatment: Rotate crops regularly. Monitor for pests and diseases. Maintain proper plant nutrition.

Squash___Powdery_mildew.symptoms: White, powdery coating on leaves and stems. Leaves may yellow and wilt.
Squash___Powdery_mildew.treatment: Apply sulfur-based fungicides. Improve air circulation. Remove infected plant parts. Use resistant varieties.

Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.symptoms: Purple to reddish-brown spots on leaves. Spots may have white or gray centers.
Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.treatment: Remove infected leaves. Apply fungicides containing captan. Improve air circulation. Avoid overhead watering.

Strawberry___healthy.symptoms: No disease symptoms present. Leaves are green and healthy.
Strawberry___healthy.treatment: Regular removal of old leaves. Proper spacing for air circulation. Monitor for pests and diseases.

Tomato___Bacterial_spot.symptoms: Small, dark, raised spots on leaves and fruit. Leaves may yellow and drop.
Tomato___Bacterial_spot.treatment: Use copper-based bactericides. Remove infected plants. Use certified disease-free seeds. Avoid overhead watering.

Tomato___Early_blight.symptoms: Dark, concentric ring spots on older leaves. Stem lesions may girdle the plant.
Tomato___Early_blight.treatment: Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil. Remove infected foliage. Stake plants for air circulation. Mulch to prevent soil splash.

Tomato___Late_blight.symptoms: Water-soaked lesions that turn brown. White fuzzy growth on leaf undersides in humid conditions.
Tomato___Late_blight.treatment: Apply fungicides containing metalaxyl or copper immediately. Remove infected plants. Avoid overhead watering.

Tomato___Leaf_Mold.symptoms: Yellow spots on upper leaf surfaces. Fuzzy olive-green growth on undersides.
Tomato___Leaf_Mold.treatment: Improve air circulation. Reduce humidity. Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil. Remove infected leaves.

Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.symptoms: Small, circular spots with dark borders and gray centers. Black specks in spot centers.
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.treatment: Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil or copper. Remove infected lower leaves. Mulch to prevent soil splash.

Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider.symptoms: Fine webbing on leaves. Stippled, yellowing leaves. Tiny moving dots on leaf undersides.
Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider.treatment: Increase humidity around plants. Use miticides or insecticidal soap. Remove heavily infested leaves. Encourage beneficial insects.

Tomato___Target_Spot.symptoms: Circular spots with concentric rings on leaves and fruit. Spots have yellow halos.
Tomato___Target_Spot.treatment: Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil. Remove infected plant debris. Improve air circulation. Avoid overhead watering.

Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.symptoms: Upward curling and yellowing of leaves. Stunted plant growth. Reduced fruit production.
Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.treatment: Remove infected plants immediately. Control whitefly vectors. Use virus-resistant varieties. Remove weeds that harbor the virus.

Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.symptoms: Mottled light and dark green patterns on leaves. Leaf distortion and stunted growth.
Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.treatment: Remove infected plants. Disinfect tools between plants. Use virus-free seeds. Control aphid vectors.

Tomato___healthy.symptoms: No disease symptoms present. Leaves are green and healthy.
Tomato___healthy.treatment: Regular monitoring for diseases. Proper spacing for air circulation. Consistent watering and fertilization.
